org.metastatic.sexp4j

Interface Writer

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AdvancedWriter, CanonicalWriter

    public interface Writer
    An s-expression writer.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void beginList()
      Begin a list.
      void endList()
      End a list.
      int writeAtom(Atom atom)
      Write an atom.
      int writeExpression(Expression expression)
      Write an expression.
      int writeList(ExpressionList list)
      Write a list.

    • Method Detail

      • writeAtom

        int writeAtom(Atom atom)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Write an atom.

        It is invalid to write an atom if a single atom has already been written, or if a list in its entirety has been written previously.

        Parameters:
        atom - The atom to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        WriteException - If an illegal write state occurs.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • writeList

        int writeList(ExpressionList list)
       throws java.io.IOException
        Write a list.

        It is invalid to write a list if a single atom was written as the only value, or if a complete list was written previously.

        Parameters:
        list - The list to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        WriteException - If an illegal write state occurs.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • beginList

        void beginList()
        throws java.io.IOException
        Begin a list. You don't need to call this along with writeList(ExpressionList), this method exists to support writing expressions without building them as ExpressionList instances first.
        Throws:
        WriteException - If it is illegal to begin a list in the current state.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • endList

        void endList()
      throws java.io.IOException
        End a list. You should call this if you use the beginList() method to start a list.
        Throws:
        WriteException - if it is illegal to end a list in the current state.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.

      • writeExpression

        int writeExpression(Expression expression)
             throws java.io.IOException
        Write an expression.
        Parameters:
        expression - The expression to write.
        Returns:
        The number of bytes written.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if the argument is null.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the argument is not a Atom or a ExpressionList.
        WriteException - If an illegal write state occurs.
        java.io.IOException - If an IO exception occurs.
        See Also:
        writeAtom(Atom), writeList(ExpressionList)
